website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable coverage, responsive cushioning and a trail-ready outsole enable the Adidas Kanadia 7 to provide dependable performance in the great outdoors. A lot of runners and athletes praised its design, its cushioning and its grip on multiple types of topography. A polarizing user review criticized the outsole’s performance on wet surfaces but didn’t seem to be the case for a great majority of those who tried this neutral trail shoe.
pros: The general feedback for the Adidas Kanadia 7 was positive and many said that it was very comfortable and agreeable to their performance on the trails
An athlete wrote that they had no issue with this model when they used it for off-road racing competitions
The trail-ready outsole was lauded by testers because it was able to hold onto the trail surfaces with ease
Rocks, grass, dirt and mud weren’t much of a problem for this model, as observed by a majority of users
A purchaser stated that they would recommend the Adidas Kanadia 7 to a friend because it was long-lasting, and that it had perfect quality
The upper unit felt snug but not too tight, noted some runners
A lot of testers wrote that they had a good price for such a quality trail running shoe
cons: A user complained that the toe-box was too big and that it caused their foot to slide around a little bit
One tester noted that the outsole grip wasn’t as strong on wet surfaces because they slipped and fell under such conditions

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes for trail running in wet, muddy and slippery conditions.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pair of kanadias and I love them. I've tried other more expensive shoes but keep coming back to them. I mainly run in slippery muddy conditions and so the grippy sole is a great feature. In the dry of summer they also provide sufficient cushioning on dry paths. It is a fortunate coincidence that they are also very reasonably priced. Sizing seems to have changed a bit recently - I ordered size 8.5 last time and they were too small so I upsized to 9. This time around size 9 seems a bit too large but not enough to be a problem. Adidas also seem to suit those with a narrower foot.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe but caution with regard to grip on the road.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes as a trail equivalent of the Supernova road shoe. They are an excellent match in size, feel, comfort. But I have one word of caution. I am training for a trail run in the summer but have been doing a lot of my winter training on the road. Whilst the grip on these shoes is excellent on the trails (as you would hope), on smooth, damp tarmac they are actually quite slippy, and on occasion I have almost ended up on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Gorranbythesea

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Bought these basically so I didn't have to ruin my nice Brooks shoes in the mud. Work fine as trail shoes but very little cushioning - like running on pieces of cardboard. Also a bit too over-formed in the heel cup so that the rear lip digs into the achilles. Got blisters until they'd been broken in. Never had a single blister with Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff R

customer_reviews.title: Superb shoes
customer_reviews.text: Amazing off road shoe for the price - better than shoes costing twice as much, great cleated sole and easy to clean mud off. You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip
customer_reviews.text: Just wore them for the first time this morning and although it's early days I have to say I was very pleased. Provided excellent grip on my weekly trail run where previously I was sliding all over the place!! Superb for the price....
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Excell

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear
customer_reviews.text: Most uncomfortable trainers I’ve ever worn on my first run they tore my feet to shreds couldn’t return them because of the blood stains
customer_reviews.author: Cycle king

customer_reviews.title: Just the job
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight and comfortable shoe. Used on and off road with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good grip on wet/ mossy tarmac
customer_reviews.text: I had to put insoles in to raise foot to stop the sides digging into my ankles. Not good grip on wet/ mossy tarmac.
customer_reviews.author: Neill P.

customer_reviews.title: Going down hill!
customer_reviews.text: After previous pairs of the same make and model I was expecting better. These feel flimsier, and have much poorer instep padding. Will find a use but will need better for running
customer_reviews.author: N A.

customer_reviews.title: good grip, a great pair of running shoes for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy, good grip, a great pair of running shoes for the price
customer_reviews.author: Steve J

customer_reviews.title: great value and do the job
customer_reviews.text: Fit to size, great value and do the job. Happy.
customer_reviews.author: H M Hesling

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value trainer, looking to use for rat race and total warrior, great grip.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Halls

customer_reviews.title: Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price, grip is excellent in wet/muddy conditions!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seriously comfortable and light. I feel ready to run as soon as they're on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Prompt and as advertised. What more could you ask for. I will be using Google their services again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old ones were better
customer_reviews.text: They are ok but my previous ones tr5 are much more comfortable and seem to have a better cushioning and arch support
customer_reviews.author: big j

product_meta.title: adidas Kanadia 7 Trail, Men's Running Shoes
product_meta.description: One of the most beloved all round trail shoes is back, lighter and more comfortable than previous instalments. Ready to take on any trail with a TRAXIONTM outsole, waterproofing implements strategically located help keep rain at bay. Constructed with an air mesh upper for maximum ventilation, this is achieved through the process of allowing air to permeate the exterior, incurring airflow within the interior. A waterproof mudguard situated at the bottom of the shoes helps to keep water and mud from seeping through. A textile lining enhances comfort from the inside, whilst an engineered 3-stripe panel provides optimum linear and lateral support. Finished with a TRAXIONTM outsole, maximum grip in a multitude of directions is granted to the wearer.
